00002 #include "Buffer.hpp"

00004 namespace ntee {
00005 
00009 Buffer* BinaryDataReader::mkBuffer()
00010 {
00011    char dest;
00012    fd_.read( &dest, sizeof(char));
00013    uint32_t llen;
00014    fd_.read( reinterpret_cast<char*>(&llen), sizeof(uint32_t));
00015    llen = ntohl(llen);
00016    char* buf = (char*) malloc( llen );
00017    llen = fd_.readsome( buf, llen );
00018    
00019    // If any of the reads got to EOF, then delete the malloc, and return null.
00020    if ( fd_.eof() ) {
00021       free( buf ); 
00022       return 0;
00023    }
00024    
00025    // Not the EOF, so allocate a buffer and fill it up.
00026    Buffer* pB = new Buffer();
00027    pB->len = llen;
00028    pB->buf = buf;
00029    pB->type = (dest == 'L')?R_to_L
00030                            :L_to_R;
00031    return pB;
00032 }
00033

00043 int BinaryDataReader::open( const std::string& s )
00044 {
00045    using namespace std;
00046    fd_.open( s.c_str(), fstream::in|fstream::binary );
00047    return (fd_.good())?0:-1;
00048 }
00049 
00050 
00052 bool BinaryDataReader::good() const
00053 {
00054    return fd_.good();
00055 }
00056 
00057 
00064 Buffer* BinaryDataReader::getNext( const TransferType& tt )
00065 {
00066    Buffer* pB = 0;
00067    while ( (pB=mkBuffer()) != 0 && pB->type != tt ) {
00068       delete pB;  // throw buffers of wrong type away!
00069    }
00070    return pB;
00071 }
00072 
00073 
00081 Buffer* BinaryDataReader::getNext()
00082 {
00083    return mkBuffer();
00084 }

00093 bool BinaryDataReader::eof() const 
00094 {
00095    return fd_.eof();
00096 }
